title: Relates to the requirements of licensing and voter registration forms

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         4165

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. TEDISCO, J. MILLER, MOLINARO, McKEVITT, BARCLAY,
         TOBACCO, KOLB -- Multi-Sponsored  by  --  M.  of  A.  AMEDORE,  BOYLE,
         BURLING,  BUTLER,  CALHOUN,  CONTE,  CROUCH,  DUPREY,  FINCH,  GIGLIO,
         HAWLEY, HAYES, P. LOPEZ,  McDONOUGH,  OAKS,  RABBITT,  RAIA,  REILICH,
         SALADINO, SAYWARD -- read once and referred to the Committee on Trans-
         portation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the require-
         ments of licensing and to amend the election law, in relation to voter
         registration forms

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 502 of  the  vehicle  and  traffic
    2  law,  as  amended by chapter 639 of the laws of 2006, is amended to read
    3  as follows:
    4    1. Application for license.  Application for a driver's license  shall
    5  be made to the commissioner.  The fee prescribed by law may be submitted
    6  with  such application. The [applicant shall furnish such proof of iden-
    7  tity, age, and fitness as may  be  required  by  the  commissioner.  The
    8  commissioner  may  also  provide  that  the] application procedure shall
    9  include the taking of a photo  image  or  images  of  the  applicant  in
   10  accordance with rules and regulations prescribed by the commissioner. In
   11  addition,  the  commissioner  [also]  shall  require  that the applicant
   12  provide PROOF OF FITNESS, AGE AND IDENTITY INCLUDING his or  her  social
   13  security  number  [and], OR PROVIDE PROOF THAT HE OR SHE IS NOT ELIGIBLE
   14  FOR A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER. SUCH PROOF  SHALL  INCLUDE  ANY  DOCUMENTS
   15  SUBMITTED  BY  AN  APPLICANT TO THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND
   16  SECURITY FOR THE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING WHETHER SUCH APPLICANT IS ELIGI-
   17  BLE TO RECEIVE A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  ALSO
   18  provide  space  on the application so that the applicant may register in
   19  the New York state organ and tissue donor registry under section  forty-
   20  three  hundred  ten  of the public health law. In addition, an applicant

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07316-01-1

       A. 4165                             2

    1  for a commercial driver's license who will operate  a  commercial  motor
    2  vehicle  in  interstate commerce shall certify that such applicant meets
    3  the requirements to operate a commercial motor vehicle, as set forth  in
    4  public  law 99-570, title XII, and title 49 of the code of federal regu-
    5  lations, and all regulations promulgated by the United States  secretary
    6  of transportation under the hazardous materials transportation act. Upon
    7  a  determination  that  the  holder of a commercial driver's license has
    8  made any false statement, with  respect  to  the  application  for  such
    9  license, the commissioner shall revoke such license.
   10    S 2. Section 502 of the vehicle and traffic law is amended by adding a
   11  new subdivision 1-a to read as follows:
   12    1-A.  FALSE  STATEMENTS. ANY PERSON KNOWINGLY MAKING A FALSE STATEMENT
   13  REGARDING A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER OR INELIGIBILITY FOR A SOCIAL SECURI-
   14  TY NUMBER IN AN APPLICATION FOR A DRIVER'S LICENSE OR  LEARNER'S  PERMIT
   15  ISSUED  BY  THE  COMMISSIONER  OR  IN  ANY PROOF OR STATEMENT IN WRITING
   16  SUBMITTED IN CONNECTION WITH SUCH SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER OR  INELIGIBIL-
   17  ITY  FOR A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER AND THE SUBMISSION OF SUCH AN APPLICA-
   18  TION SHALL BE GUILTY OF A MISDEMEANOR PURSUANT TO SECTION THREE  HUNDRED
   19  NINETY-TWO OF THIS CHAPTER.
   20    S  3. Paragraph (a) of subdivision 6 of section 502 of the vehicle and
   21  traffic law, as amended by section 3 of part K of chapter 59 of the laws
   22  of 2009, is amended to read as follows:
   23    (a) A license issued pursuant to  subdivision  five  of  this  section
   24  shall  be valid until the expiration date contained thereon, unless such
   25  license is suspended, revoked or cancelled. Such license may be  renewed
   26  by  submission of an application for renewal, the fee prescribed by law,
   27  proofs of prior licensing, fitness and acceptable vision  prescribed  by
   28  the  commissioner,  the  applicant's  social  security  number,  [and if
   29  required by the commissioner] OR PROVIDE PROOF THAT HE  OR  SHE  IS  NOT
   30  ELIGIBLE  FOR  A  SOCIAL  SECURITY  NUMBER. SUCH PROOF SHALL INCLUDE ANY
   31  DOCUMENTS SUBMITTED BY AN APPLICANT TO THE UNITED STATES  DEPARTMENT  OF
   32  HOMELAND  SECURITY FOR THE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING WHETHER SUCH APPLICANT
   33  IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER. THE COMMISSIONER  SHALL
   34  ALSO  REQUIRE  SUBMISSION  OF  a  photo  image  of the applicant in such
   35  numbers and form as the commissioner shall prescribe.   In addition,  an
   36  applicant  for  renewal  of  a  license  containing a hazardous material
   37  endorsement shall pass an examination to retain  such  endorsement.  The
   38  commissioner shall, with respect to the renewal of a hazardous materials
   39  endorsement,  comply  with  the  requirements  imposed  upon  states  by
   40  sections 383.141 and 1572.13 of title 49 of the code  of  federal  regu-
   41  lations.  A  renewal of such license shall be issued by the commissioner
   42  upon approval of such application, except that no such license shall  be
   43  issued  if  its  issuance  would  be inconsistent with the provisions of
   44  section five hundred sixteen of this title, and except that the  commis-
   45  sioner  may  refuse to renew such license if the applicant is the holder
   46  of a currently valid or renewable license to  drive  issued  by  another
   47  state or foreign country unless the applicant surrenders such license.
   48    S  4.  Subdivision  1 of section 503 of the vehicle and traffic law is
   49  amended by adding a new paragraph (c) to read as follows:
   50    (C) WHENEVER A DRIVER'S LICENSE, LEARNER'S PERMIT OR  A  PRIVILEGE  OF
   51  OPERATING  A  MOTOR VEHICLE OR OF OBTAINING A LICENSE HAS BEEN ISSUED TO
   52  AN ALIEN WHO HAS BEEN LAWFULLY  ISSUED  A  VISA  BY  THE  UNITED  STATES
   53  DEPARTMENT  OF  STATE,  SUCH  DRIVER'S LICENSE OR LEARNER'S PERMIT SHALL
   54  EXPIRE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF THE VISA.
   55    S 5. Section 491 of the vehicle and traffic law is amended by adding a
   56  new subdivision 1-a to read as follows:

       A. 4165                             3

    1    1-A. PERIOD OF VALIDITY; VISA. WHENEVER AN IDENTIFICATION CARD  ISSUED
    2  BY  THE  DEPARTMENT  HAS  BEEN  ISSUED TO AN ALIEN WHO HAS LAWFULLY BEEN
    3  ISSUED A VALID VISA BY THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF STATE, SUCH IDEN-
    4  TIFICATION CARD SHALL EXPIRE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF THE VISA.
    5    S 6. Subparagraph (i) of paragraph (a) of subdivision 3 of section 490
    6  of the vehicle and traffic law, as amended by chapter 235 of the laws of
    7  2002, is amended to read as follows:
    8    (i)  The commissioner shall upon submission of an appropriate applica-
    9  tion, upon payment of the prescribed fee,  [and]  upon  being  satisfied
   10  [that  the  person  described  is the applicant and] that such applicant
   11  meets the requirements set forth in subdivision two of this section, AND
   12  THAT THE PERSON DESCRIBED IS  THE  APPLICANT  AND  UPON  SUCH  APPLICANT
   13  PROVIDING  HIS  OR HER SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER OR PROVIDING PROOF THAT HE
   14  OR SHE IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER, INCLUDING ANY DOCU-
   15  MENTS SUBMITTED BY SUCH APPLICANT TO THE  UNITED  STATES  DEPARTMENT  OF
   16  HOMELAND  SECURITY FOR THE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING WHETHER SUCH APPLICANT
   17  IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER, issue to such applicant
   18  a nontransferable identification card.  [In addition,  the  commissioner
   19  also  shall  require  that  an  applicant  for an identification card or
   20  renewal thereof provide his or her social security number.]
   21    S 7. Paragraph (a) of subdivision 3 of section 490 of the vehicle  and
   22  traffic  law  is  amended  by  adding a new subparagraph (iv) to read as
   23  follows:
   24    (IV) ANY PERSON KNOWINGLY MAKING A FALSE STATEMENT REGARDING A  SOCIAL
   25  SECURITY  NUMBER  OR  INELIGIBILITY  FOR  A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER IN AN
   26  APPLICATION FOR AN IDENTIFICATION CARD ISSUED BY THE COMMISSIONER OR  IN
   27  ANY  PROOF  OR  STATEMENT  IN  WRITING SUBMITTED IN CONNECTION WITH SUCH
   28  SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER OR INELIGIBILITY FOR A SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER AND
   29  THE SUBMISSION OF SUCH AN APPLICATION SHALL BE GUILTY OF  A  MISDEMEANOR
   30  PURSUANT TO SECTION THREE HUNDRED NINETY-TWO OF THIS CHAPTER.
   31    S  8. Paragraph (c) of subdivision 3 of section 490 of the vehicle and
   32  traffic law, as amended by chapter 600 of the laws of 1989,  is  amended
   33  to read as follows:
   34    (c) The identification card [may] SHALL also contain the photograph of
   35  the  holder pursuant to regulations established by the commissioner. Any
   36  photograph taken as part of the application procedure for an identifica-
   37  tion card shall not be a public record.
   38    S 9. Subdivision 3 of section 5-212 of the election law is amended  by
   39  adding a new paragraph (d) to read as follows:
   40    (D) SHALL BE CLEARLY MARKED TO READ "FOR U.S. CITIZENS ONLY".
   41    S 10. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the requirements of licensing and to amend the election law, in relation to voter registration forms
